rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative directly modifying a risk-adjective. 'low' modifies 'risk' (noun).
statement_text: The CDC continues to characterize the risk posed to the general public by the H5N1 outbreak as “low.” This [finding of more ill health workers] marks the third time that Missouri has revealed that it had found health workers who had flu-like illness after treating the unnamed H5N1 patient, who was hospitalized on Aug. 22.
